sentence.Network_en: Suffice to say, it was more than a couple of years ago!
sentence.Network_cn: 我只想说，那是几年前的事了！

sentence.Network_en: Suffice it to say that afterwards we never met again.
sentence.Network_cn: 简单地说，此后我们再也没有见过面。

sentence.Network_en: Generally a brief note or a phone call will suffice.
sentence.Network_cn: 通常写个便条或打个电话就足够了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... proficiency n 精通，熟练 suffice v 使满足，充足 sufficient a 足够的，充分的.
...cing）这个字是满意（satisfying）和「足够」（sufficing）两个字的组合，从设计问题的角度来说，就是「好或令人满意，而非最适 …
Two bottles of wine will suffice for lunch ., 午餐有两瓶葡萄酒就够了.

list.abs: One filter usually suffices for the entire visible range of wavelengths ., 通常能满足整个可见光波范围的需要.
Will & 5 suffice you ?, 5 镑够你用吗?
I can't tell you exactly where the averages were , but suffice it to say the mood on the desk was intense as the market slid down a slippery slope .我不能确切说出我们仓位的平均成本，但可以感觉到，随着市场进入快速下跌通道，交易席位上的气氛紧张起来。
these rations will suffice until next week ., 这些给养能够支持到下星期.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that one is saying enough to make one's meaning clear while withholding something for reasons of discretion or brevity
jx.jx_cn_mean: 只要说…就够了，简单地说

lj.lj_ly: suffice it to say that they were not considered suitable for this project.
lj.lj_ls: 简单地说，他们被认为不适合做这项工程。

means.word_mean: 充足,使满意,完成,浸透,成功,击中

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French suffis-, stem of suffire, from Latin sufficere 'put under, meet the need of', from sub- 'under' + facere 'make'

entry.def: If you say that something will suffice, you mean it will be enough to achieve a purpose or to fulfil a need.

example.ex: A cover letter should never exceed one page; often a far shorter letter will suffice.
example.tran: 附信不应超过一页，通常来说，一封相对非常简短的信就足够了。

entry.tran: (用于句首)无须多说，只需说…就够了
entry.def: Suffice it to say or suffice to say is used at the beginning of a statement to indicate that what you are saying is obvious, or that you will only give a short explanation.

example.ex: Suffice it to say that afterwards we never met again...
example.tran: 简单地说，此后我们再也没有见过面。

example.ex: Suffice to say, it was more than a couple of years ago!
example.tran: 我只想说，那是几年前的事了！

means.word_mean: 1. be sufficient; be adequate, either in quality or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "A 'B' grade doesn't suffice to get me into medical school"

auth_sentence.content: Suffice to say, journalism is no different either.
auth_sentence.res_content: Suffice to say, journalism is no different either.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Suffice to say, journalism is no different either.

auth_sentence.content: It will suffice...to recall the highlights of the talks.
auth_sentence.res_content: It will suffice...to recall the highlights of the talks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It will suffice...to recall the highlights of the talks.

auth_sentence.content: It's not whether science and material explanations suffice.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not whether science and material explanations suffice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's not whether science and material explanations suffice.

stems_affixes.word_buile: suffice充足,足够+ent表形容词→sufficient在下面先做好,用的时候→足够的
sacri神圣+fice做,制作→为神做的东西→牺牲品
sacri神圣+fice做,制作→为神做的东西→牺牲品
suf下面+fice做,制作→在下面先做好→充足

sentences.en: Two bottles of wine will suffice for lunch.
sentences.cn: 午餐有两瓶葡萄酒就够了。

sentences.en: Some bread and soup will suffice me.
sentences.cn: 有面包和汤对我来说就足够了。

jushi.chinese: 一个简单的答案就足够了。

jushi.english: No words will suffice to convey his grief.
jushi.chinese: 他的悲伤是无法用言词表达的。
